metadata.name: Logger
metadata.description:
Logger

A (mostly) API compatible logger for ruby’s Logger.

metadata.name: unknown
metadata.description: Log an UNKNOWN message. This will be printed no matter what the logger’s level is.

metadata.name: add
metadata.description: Log a message if the given severity is high enough. This is the generic logging method. Users will be more inclined to use {#debug}, {#info}, {#warn}, {#error}, and {#fatal}.

metadata.name: debug?
metadata.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending DEBUG messages.

metadata.name: info?
metadata.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending INFO messages.

metadata.name: warn?
metadata.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending WARN messages.

metadata.name: error?
metadata.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending ERROR messages.

metadata.name: fatal?
metadata.description: Returns true if the current severity level allows for sending FATAL messages.
